    • Method Detail

      • cVerifyEquals

        public static void cVerifyEquals(java.lang.Object expectedValue,
                                 java.lang.Object actualValue,
                                 java.lang.Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that two strings are equal if VerificationType is true, or not equal if VerificationType is false.
        Parameters:
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        actualValue - the actual value (calculated data) of this verification
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the objects are equal, or 'false' for a negative verification that the objects are not equal

      • cVerifyNull

        public static void cVerifyNull(java.lang.Object object,
                               java.lang.Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that object is null if VerificationType is true, or not equal if VerificationType is false.
        Parameters:
        object - the object under test
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the object refers to null, or 'false' for a negative verification that the object doesn't refer to null

      • cVerifyElementExists

        public static void cVerifyElementExists(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                        org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                        java.lang.Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that webElement exists if VerificationType is true, or does not exist if VerificationType is false.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the element exists, or 'false' for a negative verification that the element doesn't exist

      • cVerifyElementAttribute

        public static void cVerifyElementAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                           org.openqa.selenium.By elementLocator,
                                           java.lang.String elementAttribute,
                                           java.lang.String expectedValue,
                                           java.lang.Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that webElement attribute equals expectedValue if verificationType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is false.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        elementLocator - the locator of the webElement under test (By xpath, id, selector, name ...etc)
        elementAttribute - the desired attribute of the webElement under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the element attribute actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative verification that the element attribute actual value doesn't match the expected value

      • cVerifyBrowserAttribute

        public static void cVerifyBrowserAttribute(org.openqa.selenium.WebDriver driver,
                                           java.lang.String browserAttribute,
                                           java.lang.String expectedValue,
                                           java.lang.Boolean verificationType)
        Verifies that browser attribute equals expectedValue if verificationType is true, or does not equal expectedValue if verificationType is false.
        Parameters:
        driver - the current instance of Selenium webdriver
        browserAttribute - the desired attribute of the browser window under test
        expectedValue - the expected value (test data) of this verification
        verificationType - either 'true' for a positive verification that the browser attribute actual value matches the expected value, or 'false' for a negative verification that the browser attribute actual value doesn't match the expected value
